content.question: A regional highway uses 8 tollbooths that are open to all vehicles. A chi-square goodness-of-fit test using a significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was conducted to determine whether the tollbooths are all used in equal proportions. A chi-square value of <math alttext="chi square equals 19.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>χ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>19.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was calculated with a corresponding <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.008. Which of the following is correct?

choices.label: There is insufficient evidence to suggest that the tollbooths are not used in equal proportions.
There is insufficient evidence to suggest that the tollbooths are used in equal proportions.
There is sufficient evidence to suggest that the tollbooths are not used in equal proportions.
There is sufficient evidence to suggest that the tollbooths are used in equal proportions.
The tollbooths are used in equal proportions.

content.answer: There is sufficient evidence to suggest that the tollbooths are not used in equal proportions.

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
